sub_topic: Calculating the boiling and melting points of inorganic compounds
message_1: What is the boiling point of magnesium oxide (MgO) at a pressure of 1 atm?
message_2: Magnesium oxide (MgO) has an extremely high boiling point. At a pressure of 1 atmosphere (atm), the boiling point of MgO is approximately 3,600 degrees Celsius (6,512 degrees Fahrenheit).
